title: Authorizes school boards to allow certain students to use inhalers or nebulizers
summary: Authorizes school boards to allow certain students to use inhalers or nebulizers; requires the school that authorizes the use of an inhaler to prepare an emergency action plan for the student; ensures safety of all students who suffer from respiratory illnesses in New York.

       AN  ACT  to  amend the education law, in relation to the use of inhalers
         and nebulizers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 916 of the education law, as amended by chapter 524
    2  of the laws of 2006, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S  916. Pupils afflicted with asthma OR OTHER POTENTIALLY LIFE-THREAT-
    4  ENING ILLNESSES.  1. The board of education or trustees of  each  school
    5  district  and  board  of  cooperative  educational  services shall allow
    6  pupils who have been diagnosed by a physician or other  duly  authorized
    7  health  care  provider with a severe asthmatic condition OR OTHER POTEN-
    8  TIALLY LIFE-THREATENING ILLNESS to carry and use  a  prescribed  inhaler
    9  during  the  school  day,  with the written permission of a physician or
   10  other duly authorized health care provider, and parental consent,  based
   11  on  such  physician's  or  provider's  determination  that such pupil is
   12  subject to sudden asthmatic attacks severe  enough  to  debilitate  such
   13  pupil.  A  record  of  such permission shall be maintained in the school
   14  office. In addition, upon the written request of a parent or  person  in
   15  parental  relation,  the  board  of  education  or  trustees of a school
   16  district and board of cooperative educational services shall allow  such
   17  pupils  to  maintain  an extra such inhaler in the care and custody of a
   18  registered professional nurse employed by  such  district  or  board  of
   19  cooperative educational services.  Nothing in this section shall require
   20  a school district or board of cooperative educational services to retain
   21  a  school  nurse  solely  for  the  purpose of taking custody of a spare

    1  inhaler, or require that a school nurse be available at all times  in  a
    2  school building for such purpose.
    3    2. THE BOARD OF EDUCATION OR TRUSTEES OF EACH SCHOOL DISTRICT OR BOARD
    4  OF  COOPERATIVE  EDUCATIONAL  SERVICES  THAT  HAS  ALLOWED THE USE OF AN
    5  INHALER BY A STUDENT PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF
    6  THIS  SECTION SHALL INFORM THE PARENTS, GUARDIANS OR PERSONS IN PARENTAL
    7  RELATION TO THE PUPIL IN WRITING THAT THE SCHOOL DISTRICT  OR  BOARD  OF
    8  COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND ITS EMPLOYEES OR AGENTS SHALL INCUR
    9  NO LIABILITY AS A RESULT OF ANY INJURY ARISING FROM THE SELF-ADMINISTRA-
   10  TION  OF  MEDICATION  BY THE PUPIL. THE PARENTS, GUARDIANS OR PERSONS IN
   11  PARENTAL RELATION TO THE PUPIL SHALL SIGN A STATEMENT ACKNOWLEDGING THAT
   12  THE DISTRICT OR BOARD OF COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES SHALL INCUR NO
   13  LIABILITY AS A RESULT OF ANY INJURY ARISING FROM THE SELF-ADMINISTRATION
   14  OF MEDICATION BY THE PUPIL AND THE  PARENTS,  GUARDIANS  OR  PERSONS  IN
   15  PARENTAL  RELATION SHALL INDEMNIFY AND HOLD HARMLESS THE SCHOOL DISTRICT
   16  OR BOARD OF COOPERATIVE  EDUCATIONAL  SERVICES  AND  ITS  EMPLOYEES  AND
   17  AGENTS  ANY  CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF THE SELF-ADMINISTRATION OF MEDICATION
   18  BY THE PUPIL.
   19    3. THE BOARD OF EDUCATION OR TRUSTEES OF EACH SCHOOL DISTRICT OR BOARD
   20  OF COOPERATIVE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES THAT  HAS  ALLOWED  THE  USE  OF  AN
   21  INHALER  BY  A  STUDENT PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF
   22  THIS SECTION SHALL PREPARE  AN  EMERGENCY  ACTION  PLAN  FOR  EACH  SUCH
   23  STUDENT.  THE  COMMISSIONER,  IN  CONSULTATION  WITH THE COMMISSIONER OF
   24  HEALTH AND A PHYSICIAN, SHALL DETERMINE THE INFORMATION, ACTIONS, AND/OR
   25  PROCEDURES THAT MUST BE CONTAINED WITHIN EACH PLAN.
   26    S 2. The education law is amended by adding a new section 921 to  read
   27  as follows:
   28    S  921.  USE  OF  NEBULIZER. 1. EVERY SCHOOL DISTRICT, BOARD OF EDUCA-
   29  TIONAL SERVICES AND NONPUBLIC ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY  SCHOOL  IN  THIS
   30  STATE  SHALL  REQUIRE AT LEAST ONE NEBULIZER BE MAINTAINED IN THE OFFICE
   31  OF THE SCHOOL NURSE OR IN A SIMILAR ACCESSIBLE LOCATION.
   32    2. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL  PROMULGATE  REGULATIONS  FOR  THE  ADMINIS-
   33  TRATION  OF  ASTHMA  MEDICATION  THROUGH  THE  USE OF A NEBULIZER BY THE
   34  SCHOOL NURSE OR PERSON AUTHORIZED BY REGULATION. THE  REGULATIONS  SHALL
   35  INCLUDE:
   36    A.  A REQUIREMENT THAT EACH CERTIFIED NURSE OR OTHER PERSON AUTHORIZED
   37  TO ADMINISTER ASTHMA MEDICATION IN SCHOOLS RECEIVE  TRAINING  IN  AIRWAY
   38  MANAGEMENT  AND  IN  THE  USE OF NEBULIZERS AND INHALERS CONSISTENT WITH
   39  NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED STANDARDS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THOSE OF
   40  THE NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH AND THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF ALLER-
   41  GY AND IMMUNOLOGY; AND
   42    B. A REQUIREMENT THAT EACH PUPIL AUTHORIZED TO USE  ASTHMA  MEDICATION
   43  PURSUANT  TO  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  SECTION NINE HUNDRED SIXTEEN OF THIS
   44  ARTICLE OR A NEBULIZER HAVE AN ASTHMA TREATMENT  PLAN  PREPARED  BY  THE
   45  PHYSICIAN  OF  THE PUPIL, WHICH IDENTIFY, AT A MINIMUM, ASTHMA TRIGGERS,
   46  THE TREATMENT PLAN, AND SUCH OTHER ELEMENTS AS SHALL  BE  DETERMINED  BY
   47  THE REGENTS.
   48    3. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ENSURE THAT ANNUAL ASTHMA EDUCATION OPPORTU-
   49  NITIES  ARE MADE AVAILABLE FOR MEDICAL INSPECTORS AND ALL MEMBERS OF THE
   50  TEACHING STAFF.
   51    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   52  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   53  ly the commissioner of education is authorized to promulgate  rules  and
   54  regulations for the implementation of this act on such effective date.
